title: Check mark won't disappear by clicking the box when I am asked if I will pin an extension to the toolbar
content: Every time I add an extension I am asked if I will pin the extension to the toolbar. I try to uncheck the box because I don't want to pin the extension, but the check mark won't disappear. The pinned extension icon on toolbar disappears after I click the box and the check mark disappears after I move the cursor off the box. This happens after 146.0 was released and the same thing does on Beta and Nightly. I am confused by this and hope this will be fixed.

title: Bookmarks missing and unable to restore
content: Hello, Today my bookmarks were suddenly missing from my Firefox browser on my laptop. I checked my synced phone and the bookmarks were still there, great! So I re-synced the phone and the laptop.. all bookmarks are now gone. Okay, I'll restore them through the bookmarks manager, but no: every time I try to restore a backup version of the bookmarks, I get this error: Unable to process the backup file. I've tried to convert the backup files (jsonlz4) to HTML, but importing the HTML file into the bookmarks manager does nothing. Now what? I had so many bookmarks and I need most of them, and at this point I'm really at a loss. Please help!

title: Fonts display corrupted on Bookmark Sidebar
content: Hi! I'm having a really weird problem with fonts in Firefox on my Macbook Pro M1 14-inch 2021. Specifically, the fonts in the bookmark sidebar appear to be corrupted and replaced with nonsense characters that have a lot of accents. I've tried rebooting, clearing all Firefox cookies and site data, reinstalling Firefox from an earlier version on my Apple Time Machine (from a time when I didn't have this problem), checking to see if the problem persisted when all extensions were disabled (it did, even after restart with all extensions disabled), and a reboot in safe mode. The reboot in safe mode temporarily fixed the problem and I was pretty excited, but it came back. I tried updating my Mac from Sequoia to the most recent OS (Tahoe 26.2), and the problem was still there, so I tried rebooting in Safe Mode again and the problem went away, but only while I remained in Safe Mode. This time the problem came back when I reopened in regular mode. So whatever the problem is, it's something that Safe Mode counteracts. Can someone help me figure out what's wrong?

title: I do not want AI in my browser
content: I know some underpayed tech or a volunteer who's not getting paid at all is going to read this and not the CEO but my hope is I'm not only one complaining and that if enough people complain your new CEO will realize that the reason most people who use Firefox do is because it's the browser that respects their privacy and security the most. Adding "AI" slop into it will only contribute to bloat and privacy loss, and a lot of people will likely move on to another browser thats faster, more reliable, and less insecure. Don't try to compete with Chrome by becoming Chrome please.

title: After a hard reset on my laptop Firefox thinks it's on another device and erased all my previous settings.
content:
What it says on the tin. My laptop freezed up and had to hard reset it. I think it update windows after that and now that I open firefox, I find that not only was I logged out from my profile, but once I logged in, Firefox thinks I'm in another device and won't load my bookmarks and settings.

I know it thinks it's on another device since when I check my synced tabs, it shows the ones I had open before I had to reset my laptop. All I can think about is that something broke with the windows update and all I want is to load my previous settings, extensions and bookmarks as they were before.

Edit: I would like to add that I had it set up to stop with the ai stuff google and other companies and now they are back on, I'm quite angry since now I have to figure how to fix this and the ai content is making it harder.
